Hear Vitale spout his cager clichés:
Crash the boards! Dish the rock! Drain the J's!
Run and gun! Give and go!
Shake and bake! In the flow!
Take it strong to the hole! Ice the treys!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Poor unfortunate little Bo Peep,
Who was found on the ground in a heap,
With her crook and her hat,
Near the side of a vat.
She got poisoned while dipping her sheep.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Accipitres: order of those
Birds with talons that grow on their toes,
Like a hawk or an owl;
In addition to fowl,
It's a bandage that goes on your nose.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
A bewitching, enchanting young belle,
She's delightful — and artful, as well.
Be warned that what's charmful
Can sometimes be harmful:
Beware falling prey to her spell.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"The Apple Isle?  Part of Albania?
Or a beach in northwest Lithuania?"
"It's clear you've not read
Your assignment," she said,
"Or you'd know it's a name for Tasmania."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
At the jeweler's, the guy asked (dim-witted),
"What size are you? Ever been fitted?"
Not seeing this bit meant
A bit of commitment,
He probably should be committed.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Where the opposite brims meet at joints,
Cocked hats have just two or three points.
If two points, they're bicorne,
If three, then they're tricorne,
And one point?  The dunce it anoints!

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Some beagles excel at agility.
They run, leap, and climb with ability.
Through weave poles they dart.
Should I take that to heart?
'Twould only impair my gentility.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
As we'd planned, life was grand—simply splendid.
But we've slipped, clearly whipped—it's all ended.
It's quits; we're dead certain.
We'll move on, draw the curtain,
Neither harboring doubt nor offended.

limerick_list.author: paulthompson
limerick_list.text:
To burn ears in the US of A:
To rebuke in a powerful way.
But when British ears burn,
You discuss out of turn
Some poor sap who can't hear what you say.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
While travelling in England, Jane tried a
Large glass of a local-made cider.
She became discontented —
The drink was fermented —
And alcohol vented outside her.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
Here's the chicken Marengo short story:
Once a cook with a small inventory
Made a dish after battle.
Said Napoleon, "That'll
Be the recipe marking my glory."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"The broadcast begins when the light
Of the camera goes on, kids.  Alright?"
The emcee said.  "In five...
Four...three...two...and we're live."
Cindy Brady sat frozen in fright.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
A pastry that's shaped like a boat
On a puddle of chocolate might float.
It is called a barquette
And you'll never regret
If one happens to sail down your throat.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Many lemurs eat tender bamboo.
So would I—and why not? Wouldn't you?
It's a nourishing stalk;
Needs no knife and no fork:
You just break a piece off, and then chew.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Ephemerality: blink and you miss it.
It's a snowflake that melts as you kiss it.
It's a state that won't last,
Briefly present, now past.
Not for keeps, it is fleeting. Is this it?

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
To patients, with temperature high,
Said doctors, in days long gone by:
"The fevers that plague you
Suggest that the ague
Has visited you, I descry."

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
While their hot love was nothing but ardent,
She mangled his heart like a car dent.
In a year she returned,
But his ticker's unburned:
As it turns out, it's old-flame-retardant.

limerick_list.author: Judah
limerick_list.text:
...But when God took a hand in the game,
The construction crew swiftly became
A directionless rabble
Whose speech was a babel
Of lingos no longer the same.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
To analyze, study the parts
Of database tables or charts.
Your realizations
Of complex relations
Will add to your technical smarts.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
You are plagued by some dry, itchy skin
On your torso, your legs, or your chin.
Call your doctor; get lotion—
A medical potion.
Please don't let your eczema win.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Upon falling of darkness, benighted,
We were left with our pathway unlighted.
No lamp? 'Twas an error.
Deep woods. Deep in terror:
Unsighted, too rightly affrighted.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Your deterioration is slow.
Will this lead to your death?  Likely so.
It's called circling the drain."
"Doc, no need to explain,
'Cept for this: Is it clockwise I'll go?"

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Affordable housing's low-key.
It's low cost but I wouldn't say free,
Often government backed
And set up to attract
Low-income new buyers like me.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
My dear wife got a courtesy card.
(The shop held her in such high regard.)
But the rights it confers
Are exclusively hers,
As I found when I used it! I'm barred.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
With his name printed clearly in bold,
On a calling card bordered with gold,
A young fellow would woo.
This was his billet-doux
(Not a text or an e-mail) of old.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai and mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A costly electrical tool,
The attenuator follows this rule:
Whopping signals go in
But emerge weak and thin—
Like an amp that was built by a fool.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
The chef said the dunfish was done,
And he brought out our plates, one by one.
It's a strange name for cod,
And I find it quite odd,
But it's fancy, and different, and fun.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Petrus Plancius had charted, with love,
The patterns of stars up above.
One he labeled referred
To a Biblical bird
Sent by Noah: Columba, the Dove.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
This library gives me such grief:
All that shushing! Good Lord, what's their beef?
And they think if they try, it'll
Calm my disquietal?
This air horn should change that belief.

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Germanium's notable trait
Is semi-conducting its freight.
When properly doped,
Its electrons are roped
Into flipping a microchip's state.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Your obsolete word use? Outrageous!
It's annoying and doesn't engage us.
Disadvantageable? Hell,
You'd do equally well
To instead just use disadvantageous.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Your poetry's like an emetic:
It makes me throw up — it's pathetic.
Now this is no joke:
I do hereby revoke
Until Doomsday your license poetic.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
Said the tourist to Molly, "My dear,
Can you tell me if Dublin is near?"
But the colleen said, "No.
And if I were to go
Off to Dublin, I'd not start from here."

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
"What's an enzyme (I bet you can't guess)
That makes these here peptides process
From poly- to di-,
By hydrolysis?" "Why,
Dipeptidyl peptidase!" "Yes."

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
At the stop, two young lovers embrace.
They lock lips, wrestle tongues and suck face.
They can keep all that fuss,
Cuz all I need's a buss—
God, the service out here's a disgrace.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
'Midst the sugar beets, soybeans, and corn
Is Bay City, a little well-worn.
It's important, in short,
As a Michigan port
(And the place where Madonna was born).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Episcopicide: it means killing
A bishop. Not many are willing
To bump off a guy
Who in churchdom's so high,
And the concept itself appears chilling.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
"Take the cash and the credit forgo,"
Said Khayyam the old tentmaker. "Show
Me the money—no cheques.
If you're thinking of sex,
Then on women and wine blow your dough."

limerick_list.author: GAD
limerick_list.text:
When a question of law or of tort
Is a broad Constitutional sort,
Once the state's had its say,
One can ask that it may
Be reviewed by a federal court.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A cosset's a little pet lamb
That has recently come from its dam.
You should cosset yours while
It is small.  What a trial
When you pamper a fully grown ram!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Many lighting technicians aren't fond
Of that blizzard head. Wow, what a blonde!
Her hair is so light,
If the lighting's not right,
"Flares" shoot out for a foot or beyond.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
It's anaphoretic; its minus
Seeks anodes without any shyness.
Any positive pole
Is its goal, on the whole,
Which it seeks in the absence of dryness.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
As a field hockey player I'm built
For power when dashing full tilt.
Sure, those brutes on the ice
Might make their game look nice,
But when I play, I'm sporting a kilt!

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
All too swiftly, her life flickered past:
She breathed barely at all, then her last.
One tide of the seasons
Left nothing. The reasons
For loss leave us helpless, aghast.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A euphonium player at school
Told the bandmaster's wife, "You're so cool."
He'd shown plenty of brass,
But the lady had class.
Misperception, for him, proved the rule.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Reaching  Capitol Hill, Jack  had pluck. It
Just wasn't Jill's day. By bad luck it
Was Jackie who caught him,
Though Marilyn soon sought him—
But now they have all kicked the bucket!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Dee's got plans for diablerie—watch!
As a trickster, her plots are top-notch.
She's been challenged by friends,
So she somehow intends
To expose poor Penelope's crotch.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The clergy must be like a rock,
Underpinning and guiding their flock.
But if they're unsure
How to open the door
To their God, they're a stumbling block.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Though the baker put on a good show
Tossing disks made of raw pizza dough,
Still, a pie plate's the thing
For a long-distance fling:
Better aerodynamics, you know.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm not sure how to say this, it's true.
I had guessed that this plant's called dhamNOO,
Because DHAMnoo seemed drastic
For wood that's elastic—
But it seems that the latter will do.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Dactyls are feet that are metrical.
Labor induction's obstetrical.
Both are employable;
One's less enjoyable.
Pregnancy's making me tetrical.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
It's not cancer, nor what you've been eating—
They're just excretin chips you're excreting.
But ask yourself, cretin:
Is this question you're settin'
Really apt in this management meeting?

limerick_list.author: neilski
EdRush
limerick_list.text:
I give, without fear of redaction,
Great praise for euthermic reaction!
That pad is a heater—
A handy cold-beater.
Its chemicals bring satisfaction.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
It's adjectiveless: my new book
Which I wrote on some gobbledygook.
Critics laud it and praise
It in numerous ways
And tell everyone: "Come, take a look."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
When a paper's reporters attack,
Call on me if you want to hit back.
I can clean any mess
And square things with the  press.
It's my job, and I'm known as a flack.

limerick_list.author: John Wellington Wells
limerick_list.text:
The ash is a wonderful tree:
Its wood is as tough as can be.
And should cold become dire,
Put a log on the fire
And a new form of ash you will see.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
"This again?" Santa asks with a snort.
"Very well, then — I'll see you in court,"
As he sneers at the smears
That appear in this year's
Demythologisation Report.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
As the sun sets I wait for the sounds
Of the horses that pass through the grounds:
The steady clop-clopping
Of heavy hooves dropping
On flagstones. It always astounds.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
That fedora's not likely to flatter
Your style, since it makes you look fatter.
A simple chapeau
Is the most apropos
When one reaches the mart of the hatter.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Some artists once banded as one,
In New York, and the project begun
Was the AWS.
Today's members assess
Watercolors as art and as fun.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
This internal secretion depresses
Activity levels and stresses.
Just compare chalone to
Any hormone and you
Can say what this word means, with no guesses.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
The captain's abhorrent amenance
Caused a backlash among his lieutenants.
See, he'd tend to abuse
Both his men and his booze...
So he's now in the brig doing penance.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
A foolish young Fenian named Mick
Lost his life to a dynamite stick:
Set the fuse far too short,
Leading others to snort,
"Now if only the Brits were as thick!"

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
My church says, "We have an excuse
To switch 'blood of the grape' with grape juice.
Though the Bible says wine
Is the blood that's divine,
We can't let abstainers let loose."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and neilski
limerick_list.text:
Every hand of most clocks in creation
Engages in dextrogyration.
I could easily say,
"They turn clockwise," but, hey,
I prefer more arcane conversation.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
I love digital records! Oh my!
As the gigabytes mount to the sky,
I'm on point to ensure
That your data's secure.
I'm your database management guy.

limerick_list.author: Peter Meyer
limerick_list.text:
"Write decipherably!" read the big board
In the classroom. The schoolmaster roared,
"If your writing's unclear
I won't read it! YOU HEAR?
It takes time which I cannot afford."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Since you can't wait for soil erosion,
I'll begin with a little explosion.
Yes sir, it's my pleasure
To dig up your treasure;
Expect a rewarding effosion.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
He's accoutered his bedroom in style;
She's arriving in just a short while.
Chilled champagne at the ready,
Pillows fluffed, and her teddy
Comes off soon . . . just imagine his smile.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An advance man's prime job: intervene
In the weeks 'fore his candidate's seen.
He grapples with airlines,
Diminishing hairlines,
And every detail in between.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I've been giving you all that I've got.
I'm inflamed, flushed, red, sweaty and hot.
Febrifacient, this work;
I'm a feverish jerk —
I'm like burning up, more than I ought.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The cyanocobalamin's stable
In the cereal box on your table.
It's a form of B12,
Which you'd know if you delve
In the vitamin list on the label.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Russell
limerick_list.text:
There once was a man from Touraine
Who arranged (x, y) pairs on the plane.
His plots were so clever,
Analytic would ever
Geometry's forename remain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He molests many women, this guy.
You can catch him if only you try.
Here's a line from a tape
Of my brush with the ape:
"By the bye, take your hand off my thigh!"

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Homo sapiens, I watch and despair
While we poison our world without care.
As we plunder and kill
And destroy with a will,
Common sense seems exceedingly rare.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our ethically-challenged big boss
Showed no morals in handling his loss
'Cause he used clients' dough
As his own. This I know:
It's a rip-off I stumbled across.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
In Bangalore, puffing a smoke,
A spice trader sauntered, and spoke:
"The spices in Bangy
Are tasty and tangy!
They hang from my bangy, a yoke."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A contingent (it lurks) liability
Is a prudent accounting utility.
When a loss is potential,
Most think it essential
To show it; that's fiscal civility.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Think of duck hawk; consider each word.
Not a duck that eats hawks—that's absurd—
But a falcon that plucks
From the air flying ducks.
And it hunts mammals too; what a bird!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A puking-prone patient named Jason
Often sped to a head, forced to hasten
By his number one nemesis:
Merciless emesis,
Filling, each day, a barf basin.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When Richard the pitcher was fatter,
His splitter the hitters would splatter.
Once the score didn't matter,
Those hitters would scatter,
Since, bitter, he hit every batter!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The colt saw the bolt, senses heightened,
When the heavens abruptly had brightened.
So he risked being jolted,
And suddenly bolted
Through unbolted doors, sorely frightened.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
To know if it's archly she speaks,
Look straight at her brow (not her cheeks).
If an eyebrow is raised,
Then please don't be fazed —
She's been this ironic for weeks.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The air goes from nothing to thin
As a satellite's orbit moves in.
Soon the atmosphere will
Become thicker until
Aerobraking can truly begin.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"His name is demonic! Cast out
Its evil and make it devout!"
"No, no! Demonymics
Are not fiendish mimics.
Rob DiTrouter is merely from Trout."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
For Elvis' breakfast, one rule:
He thinks waffles and eggs are good fuel,
But considers hot porridge
Disgusting for forage.
Each morning he hopes, "Don't be gruel."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"He was sick from the get-go, I hear."
"He was bit by his lizard?  Oh dear!"
"Ma, I never said gecko;
I said, 'from the get-go'
Which means 'from the start'. Hope that's clear."

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
Charcloth: denim you want to retire
Cut and cooked in a tin on a fire
Till it's totally dark.
It'll capture your spark,
Set your tinder alight for your pyre.

limerick_list.author: nikohl
limerick_list.text:
Bionomics: an alternate word
For ecology. Haven't you heard?
It's about interaction,
One long chain reaction —
For billions of years it's occurred.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Reel-to-reel? VHS? DVD?
Those are obsolete formats! You see,
It is time for transition
To high-definition—
Get Blu-ray! It's 1080p!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In the throat of the chimney, jammed tight,
Was a chockstone, no handholds in sight.
But we'd not be confounded.
We fought our way 'round it.
Cruel north face, you're conquered tonight!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When accepting a check of the kind
That says "Pay to the Order", you find
There's a numbered account,
And the proper amount,
While neglecting to check that it's signed.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The Baikal is a strange little breed,
But the poachers all pay little heed.
They continue to take
Baby seals from the lake—
Are they blind or just driven by greed?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Sylvester is hemorrhaging! Stat,
Get the crash cart, wherever it's at!
We're in need of supplies
'Cause without 'em he dies.
(It's the ninth of the lives of this cat.)

limerick_list.author: David and Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It's been dying, the Romans' great ampersand,
And now just the signwriter pampers &.
Though there's no good excuse,
It is doomed to disuse,
For the absence of Romans still hampers &.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
"An air mattress, surely," said Kate,
"Is a must when you're out on a date.
But it takes lots of huffing
And plenty of puffing
To make it completely inflate."

limerick_list.author: Philip Chris Erickson
limerick_list.text:
A scientist once said to me,
"The mixing of ocean debris
Is bioturbation,
Or sand agitation
By creatures who live in the sea."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Pealing steeple bells: that's campanology.
Mea culpa's the sinner's apology.
When, to praise the Lord's name,
All ye faithful proclaim
"Glory Be", that's the Lesser Doxology.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
On a trip to South Africa, Basil
Unashamedly went on the razzle.
On safari next day,
His poor head made him sway
When some zebras appeared in a dazzle.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
That "pirate-speak" rumble-grunt, arr
Is a word for a wound or a scar;
"He be arred" — He is vexed,
Angered, worried. What's next?
Arr means "snarl," like a cur at a car.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Jeanette got her plane to Madrid
With three minutes to spare, lucky kid.
A vacation is planned
In that sunshiny land
If the plane doesn't crash, God forbid!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
No, it isn't a moose that's psychotic;
The elknut's not even neurotic.
It's a southeastern shrub
Used by bison for grub
In the past; just its name is exotic.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
King Arthur: some say he was fake,
Others credit what legend hath spake.
I accept the accord
On the stone and the sword,
But what gives with that broad in the lake?

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Sly Newt Gingrich renewed his attack:
"You own Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac!"
Mitt was quick to refute:
"Check your own assets, Newt!"
Shamefaced Gingrich was taken aback.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was caught boosting various sundries
On the bluest of all my Blue Mondays.
Two detectives were staring—
They saw I was wearing
My lucky aluminum undies.

limerick_list.author: PdeG
pöt
limerick_list.text:
Mum's control system? Methods galore
She'd employ on the day I turned four:
She would fasten my legs,
Shut my lips with some pegs
And, above all, she'd lock the front door.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
You backstabbing, cowardly cad!
Count me in as the first who'll be glad
When your currish deceptions
Bring heated receptions—
You'll get a good spanking from Dad!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Shells and bullets were harmless until
Cartridge-packed with some cordite: a fill
That, ignited, went crack!
In defence or attack:
A propellant to warn, maim or kill.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
The "ibis" reads Akh, "waves" are -en,
"Reed", "bread loaf", and "waves" once again,
Plus a "sun"—hieroglyphic—
Add -aten; terrific
For Amen's priests, tough mighty men.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
When Moroccans make amlou, they grind
Roasted almonds with honey, combined
With argan nut oil.
One taste, you're disloyal
To peanutty spreads, but won't mind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Dancing nude on the ledge—such depravity!
Ben, we're all of us subject to gravity.
You'll fall earthward (that's down),"
Said Ms. Brown with a frown,
"Hit the ground and create a large cavity."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
No man, in his eyes, could be finer
Than his father, who captained a liner.
"I will follow in my
Father's footsteps or die;
I, too, will be Skip," said the minor.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
To jingle, to tinkle: to ging;
A sound like a soft gentle ring.
Bound by babbling brook,
Now near nibbling nook,
Here the fairy-folk cook, dance and sing.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
Academic Health Center's for me!
The treatment is usually free!
  The new would-be doctors
  Are guided by proctors.
(For short, it is called AHC.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You're a virile young man, I'll admit,
And in movies you've been a big hit,
But I've just convinced Carrie
To wed me—to marry.
Yes, me! Eat your heart out, Brad Pitt!

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Has Boxing Day finally come?
All that Christmas unrest leaves me numb,
But the next day is dear,
With its telly and beer—
I do little but sit on my bum.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Degravation's important in cases
Of dumping a corpse when the place is
A lake. Tie some rocks
Or some large cement blocks
To your foe—he won't leave any traces.

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
To regain his cognition he battled,
But the thoughts in his head simply rattled.
"I'm ruined," he wailed;
"My theory has failed."
This scholar was woefully addled.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
We encountered a bushranger once:
"STICK 'EM UP, AND DON'T TRY ANY STUNTS!"
And (deleting his curses):
"HAND OVER YOUR PURSES;
YOUR POUNDS, PENCE AND SHILLINGS — THE BUNCE!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
David Akeman played banjo with ease
And told jokes, making Hee Haw a breeze.
Known as String Bean, this lean,
Tall performer was seen
In long night shirt and jeans to his knees.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
As a palpably awkward array
Marks a stanza that's madly all-A,
Batty bards, always daft,
Brag, "An A-canny craft!"
And attract "Crazy, ay! Canny, nay!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A fruit cup or shrimp are ideal
For the very first course of a meal,
Whetting appetites nicely,
Thus serving precisely
To highlight the cocktail's appeal.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Among nobles of Rome confarreation
Is the family's joy and foundation.
An official, a cake,
And ten witnesses make
Getting wed a divine celebration.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Aquagenic urticaria? Really?
So it's water you cannot use freely?
What an allergy! How
Do you shower? Right now
Might a dry cleaners suit you ideally?

limerick_list.author: David and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Now in jail, the abusive Don Porters
Had damaged his skis in rough waters.
After casting around
For replacements, he found
He could ski on the backs of his daughters.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
With side-glances, furtive and fleeting,
And codes that take little deleting,
We are taking no chances.
If a snooper advances,
We'll cancel our clandestine meeting.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Daisy broke Randy's heart when he found
That the bitch had been sleeping around.
He wept tears of disgust
And of pain, saying just,
"It is time you went back to the pound."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Listen, brother me not; we're no kin.
In your tribe I could never fit in.
Don't address me as such;
I recoil at your touch.
Rather view me as yang to your yin.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I, needing to peen, went around
To the hardware store. There I soon found
Ball peen hammers. It's clear
What they charged, well, was queer,
As the sign said "A dollar a pound".

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
An acicular, needle-shaped knife
Soon resolves all the strife in her life;
With a stab and a twist
Of her delicate wrist,
She's a widow, no longer a wife.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
My archnemesis caused this disaster,
My worst enemy, armed with a blaster.
 But the city I'll save
 And put him in his grave;
I'm the Flash, and I'll win 'cause I'm faster.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
At my high school, the lunch aides are vicious.
They yell,  "Eat up this goop!  It's nutritious!"
With no room for debate,
They plop glop on my plate.
Make me gag!  These old coots are malicious.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
Kansas City's a great place to eat
If you're looking for barbecued meat.
Go to Bryant's or Gates,
And the food on your plates
Will knock you right off of your feet.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
I shall wrap all my fingers in gauze
And sip sodas through seventeen straws.
I'll wear orange with pink
And eat lunch at the sink.
Ask me why and I'll say, "Just because."

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Pathologically two-faced am I?
I am not a dilogical guy!
Hey, these things that I say
You just take the wrong way.
You're illogical, babe — now, don't cry!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"You must bring her around. She's exquisite!"
"Do you mean we must come for a visit?
Or perhaps she's, instead,
Now unconscious, near dead?
Those three words can mean both, so which is it?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Tony failed at his latest endeavor
When he set himself up as a bever.
He invented a drink
Made from dust. Most folks think:
"What the hell? I'm more thirsty than ever!"

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The abacus, pearl without price:
An ancient computing device.
Sliding beads strung on rods,
One can figure the odds.
You ask: "Why's it still used?"  It's precise.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It was more than a run-of-the-mill cream;
It was made for men's hair — it was Brylcreem.
Just a dab, that would do ya
(The wet look would clue ya).
For a while, it was top-of-the-hill cream.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Don't embarrass your sister again.
She tried to act carefree, but then
Her whole face turned bright red
And she gasped when you said
That her back was attractive to men.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Don't gobble your dinner — you'll choke
Or get hiccups and wind: it's no joke.
If you wolf down your food
You look gross; you sound rude,
Like a greedy-guts, stuff-your-face bloke!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"Good-bye, my love, see you next year!"
But I doubted that Jack was sincere.
Disappointed I said,
"Beat it into your head:
Empty promise, that's all that I hear!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I'm a D.D.S. kind of a gal!"
Well, I needed some work (root canal).
For the next time, will I
Be the kind of a guy
Who makes sure she's a dentist? I shall!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Dozy Des—none too bright—is delighted
That his troth is about to be plighted.
A bad choice: she looks grim.
But he's always been dim.
In addition, he's also short-sighted.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Grandpa's binder was sheathing our wheat
When a jolt knocked me clean off my feet.
When at last I exhaled,
I'd been haywired and baled.
That old reaper's goldurned obsolete.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
All your trickery sticks in my crop.
It has gotten way over the top.
You can lie now and then —
But you never say "When."
Your bamboozling of Mom is non-stop!

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
In your fiction, a creable land
Must be strictly and carefully planned.
You have to take care
That your sea, land, and air
Are just right, lest your novel be panned.

limerick_list.author: bill ricker
limerick_list.text:
Sailing solo, the gale was a thriller!
But, in labor, she needed things stiller!
Knowing just what to do,
She thought: "First, I'll bring to,
Then bring forth (with one hand on the tiller)".

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A spermatocyte makes the decision
To split, using cellular division,
Breaks in half (not in quarters)
And produces two daughters.
Not sons? I suspect a misprision!

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
My Easter egg's hatched!!! Looky! Looky!
When it comes to young birds, I'm a rookie:
Should I fatten its belly
With worms (vermicelli?)
Or feed it a chocolate chick cookie?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Amour propre's a delicate pride
In oneself—an esteem many hide.
Since regard self-directed
Is often suspected
As vainness, best keep it inside.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Some folks in the sunny Bahamas
Took to sleeping without their pajamas.
With sex as their goal
(But with no birth control),
They are known now as papas and mamas.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My complete lack of skills I take flak on,
And to that "old as dust" you can tack on.
And a college degree?
I don't need one, you see,
Since I still have my looks to fall back on.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Met our Sarah today, said, "How do,
I've not seen you around, how are you?"
"Thanks for asking," says she,
"Fair t'middlin', thee?"
"Not too bad," I replied, "muddlin' through."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
When the middle-class folk go astray,
So much lawlessness causes dismay.
What would help cops combat
All this crime is a rat —
They'll be flippin' some burghers today.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
On the court you just move to the hoop
As the guard throws the ball in a loop.
You then sky in the air,
Catch and dunk it right there,
And complete the once rare alley-oop.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
You buckrake: you earn lots of dough
Giving speeches. And why is that so?
Cause you're famous, that's all;
You're a pol with the gall
To charge lots for a one-hour show.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
World War II saw a new code debut
Only Navajo codetalkers knew.
In a bold master-stroke,
Their own language they spoke,
And the Japanese hadn't a clue.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
If the docs had a cure worth salutin',
For which parents were prayin' and rootin',
And with vapors or salts
Could cure Asperger's faults...
Not so fast! We'd have missed Isaac Newton!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Uncle Maxwell is going to die,
And a lifetime of drinking is why.
An unreachable goal
From his youth took its toll.
Ads had told him: "Drink Canada Dry."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
What — apostrophes boring and pallid?
No, they're worth a fine sonnet or ballad.
Why, without one, God's law,
On a license I saw,
Turned to GODSLAW — divinity salad.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A salesman I know is a tempter,
From honest disclosure exempter
Than a fishwife's odd rumor.
He's anticonsumer;
His motto is caveat emptor.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As we marched, I saw Maggie was flaggingly
Slipping farther behind. I said, naggingly,
"Though this isn't a race,
You must pick up the pace.
Lift those limp-as-rags feet; don't walk draggingly."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Cytopenia," said the report.
She is pregnant and fears she'll abort.
Seems the cell count is low
In her blood. We don't know
Whether red cells or white cells are short.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This racket's an earner, for sure.
It's the dodge I've been angling for:
I'll appease all my cravings;
I've even got savings!
I will never live poor anymore.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Intervening to help them to meet,
Good Don Pedro is sweet and discreet,
And alluringly charming —
Such charm is disarming! —
So Hero is swept off her feet.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Girls think boys are the bane of the earth —
That there's nothing more lacking in worth.
They just fiddle with flies
Till their innocence dies,
Then they cause yet another boy's birth.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Ambient temperature's often controlled
In the rooms where we work and grow old.
Whether office or home,
Or hotel when we roam,
We don't like it too hot or too cold.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
You can tell by the sash of my peers
There's a creed that each fellow reveres.
We are bound for all time
By the lure of the rhyme,
And our belt gives our name: "Bandoleers".

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A nervous old bootlegger said,
"A lot of new buyers are dead.
I think my distiller
Just might be their killer —
His moonshine is loaded with lead."

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
No matter how high values climb,
You can factorise numbers in time
(Though that's quite true in theory,
You'll probably weary,
And finish well after your prime).

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
It's a genome that dogs won't think swell,
When it finds a kind host that's a cell.
AAV oft remains
A long time causing pains,
So it sounds like the virus from hell.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The colour of leaves is called blue.
The sound that a dog makes is moo.
What's that you say, son?
Yeah, your Dad's having fun;
The aforegoing facts are untrue.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
It's the same crummy job, year on year,
And I've never been no place but here.
Seems I'm deep in this rut,
And I'd do something, but,
I just can't shift my life from first gear.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This budget committee's a trap;
Their pretense of fair-mindedness, crap!
They've already agreed
On no increase.  We'll need
To use last year's amount as a cap.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Your approval's applause, and my day
Gets brightened; the memory of nay-
Saying's banished. A twitch
Of a smile throws a switch
That tells me I'm doing OK!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
His poor face is all swollen with lumps
From the bout he just lost; and the grumps
He displayed were all caught
In the TV report.
It's no wonder he's down in the dumps.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Latin's neat. What I'll show you right now's a
Phrase that lawyers employ — it's a wowser.
To curtail trials' longevity,
For the purpose of brevity,
I just say "brevitatis" then "causa".

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
In Australia, you're likely to find
These big lizards, the monitor kind.
The goannas will eat
Smaller prey, eggs, and meat.
Even carrion meals they don't mind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Put a dinner pad under his cast.
It won't last; we'll remove it real fast.
Then his belly can swell
When he's dined very well,
Till his meal, through his bowels, has passed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My sweet wife's had a lifelong affair
With old Wedgwood — their cameo ware.
It's the graceful motif
In two-color relief
She adores. She's got thousands, I swear.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
A booty-full lass, Mrs. Fidgous
Had wished she were more callipygous.
The surgeon was crass,
As he slaughtered her ass.
Now our patient is highly litigious!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Maud the bawd pauses, paws at her gaud
(A large rosary bead). She's so bored.
"Daughter, pray the Our Father,
Hail Mary..." She'd rather
Be off (oh my gawd) clawing Claude.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
John Denver was somewhat a pretty boy
Whose fans often thought him a witty boy.
He said life on a farm
Held, for him, a great charm,
But not me; I thank God I'm a city boy!

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Let us now ponder John C. Calhoun:
Gifted statesman or crazy buffoon?
"Let not one slave be freed,"
He cried, "else we'll secede!"
And the southern states danced to his tune.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Cell to mate: "My defense is in line—
I'm intact, undissolved, feeling fine.
But when bacteriolysin
Binds, dearie, all is in
Hands that are stronger than mine."

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
My Darling, I'm getting callosities
From your ardour with all its ferocities.
I've got carpet burns here
And tough skin on my rear.
Do we have to attain such velocities?

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
My basenji's a noise-making cheater;
He can't bark, but my life is no sweeter.
Through some app, he's now heard
As a strange canine bird!
He's no woofer, but what a great tweeter!

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
Said a child, Uncle Sam's misbegotten,
"I'm an apple that's thoroughly rotten.
They don't want me no more
'Cause I'm bad to the corps.
It is best that my hitch is forgotten."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Barcelona provided the name
(And an expo a measure of fame)
For a chair without arms,
But demonstrable charms—
For the elderly, weary, and lame.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
You'll find backgammon not quite as easy
As it looks (for plain fun try Parcheesi).
Throw his game out of joint
With two men on a point;
Such a block makes your end game more breezy.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Shop at Bang-Mart, for shooters real fine!
It's the one with a piece on the sign.
Pre-owned bullets, ten cents;
And for cut-price defense,
There's assault rifles, $9.99.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Distant hills are enveloped in haze
Caused by smoke rising up from a blaze.
Visibility's down
All over the town,
And the view won't be normal for days.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Always writes to the newspapers, flappin';
Gets neither rebuttal nor clappin'.
Doesn't matter becuz his
Crusade that he does is
Of no consequence. Nothing will happen.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
It is "washed" by the Thames and North Sea,
With Kent to the South vis-à-vis.
The county of Essex
Was no part of Wessex.
So much I can tell, yes sirree.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"Your eye disease isn't severe,"
Said the eye doctor, grinning, "Look here,
It's neither glaucoma
Nor hidden scotoma!
Blurry vision it is. Too much beer?"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Said the priest to his flock, "I admit
That our binary compound's unfit.
Holy water stock's low;
I will buy H20.
Then I'll boil the hell out of it."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I am gonna gleek Santa," said Joe,
"Since he loves milk and cookies, you know.
He will never perceive
That the cookies I leave
Will have ex-lax inside. Ho! Ho! Ho!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
In our staredowns, as much as I tried
Not to blink, wins were always denied
By that man Johnny Cash
Who dropped nary a lash.
All the time, he kept eyes open wide.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
These twelve steps of AA have one more
If an old-timer's looking to score
With a neophyte here,
Sober less than a year.
If you take this next step, there's the door.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Behold the aethereal fairy:
Discarnate, unworldly, and airy.
She moves from the gloom
Through the walls of the room.
Holy cow! Did you see that? She's scary!

limerick_list.author: SafetyDog
limerick_list.text:
"Invest in a 401(k).
Now's the time and you mustn't delay!"
So bellowed my broker,
A white-collared joker
Who whittled my nickels away.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My pals in the English class pause,
Then erupt in unbridled guffaws,
When I stand and avow
"Santa's helper" is how
I'm defining subordinate clause.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Stop them sucking your blood? It's no dice:
They hang on for dear life, body lice.
They're nasty, these cooties,
For certain no beauties.
They make you feel lousy — not nice!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Many thanks for the money you sent
For the Eagle Scout jamboree tent,
When I called on your aid.
Now it seems, I'm afraid,
That the Scouts have called off the event.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Little Grace is the toddler I'm raising.
There's a reason that Grace I am praising:
(Can you guess what's to come?)
She'll "Amazing Grace" hum —
Our hymn-humming Grace is amazing.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Her stories are all intertwined
With plot twists that boggle the mind.
This anfractuosity
Sparks curiosity:
Why is her writing maligned?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's an excellent play.  Here's the beauty part:
My sister-in-law plays the cutie-part,
While my mom plays the matron,
And Dad, the arts patron,
Will put up the funds—play his duty-part.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bobby's brochity (teeth sticking out)
Is unsightly without any doubt,
And it does interfere
With his diction. I hear
Garbled words. What's he talking about?

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Pink bergenia's blooms, clustered gems,
Brighten spring and late winter. Long stems
Rise from 'elephant's ears'
(That's how each leaf appears:
It's a name Mrs E Phant condemns).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Auteur  Federico Fellini
Had a talent that few would call teeny.
From sublime to obscene
Were his scenes on the screen.
His fat lady? She wore a bikini.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The borehole we drill in the soil
Requires patience and skill as we toil.
And our rig's never still:
We keep digging until
We're fulfilled by the thrill of new oil.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
"Just relax, and you'll feel more at ease.
So now tell me your worries—and please,
Don't be anxious and stop
If my eyelids should drop—
I am listening..." (but dreaming of fees).

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Exuviation's most noticed in snakes,
Which slip off their skins without breaks,
While a lizard will scratch
At a sloughing-off patch.
We humans shed cells — itsy flakes.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Would a chokeberry cause you to croak?
If it's stuck in your throat, you may choke
On this tart little fruit.
You should give it the boot,
Right along with this obvious joke.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Your anatomy texts would construe
That your "axis" is vertebra two.
Things called "axoid" pertain
To this bone, and remain
Quite a pain in the neck to review!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The autoexemplified word
Is a thrill for the lexical nerd.
Adjectival with glee,
He adverbially
Verbs the noun until gerund-ing's heard.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Is communicativeness hard for a mime?"
I responded, "
 
               ." "Yes, I'm sure
That you're misunderstood all the time."

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Freshly brewed, my hot tea is revealing
Both colour and scent quite appealing.
I'll put my feet up
And relax with this cup
Of refreshingly healing Darjeeling.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
How regrettable Zorro ignored,
As he reached for his double-edged sword,
That it's sharp on each side—
His professional pride
May not ever be fully restored.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Little brats should be seen and not heard —
So opined the Victorians. Word!
Since silence is golden
(That's also an old 'un),
All conticent kids are preferred.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My new neighbor's contrived a free ride.
Unearned income he knows how to hide.
That sly cheater relaxes,
Drinks wine, pays no taxes —
A sponge that I just can't abide.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Mom has cancer (wild cell proliferation).
Cell division and loss brought equation
Before its assault.
We hope chemo will halt
The advance of that nasty mutation.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Please give me the strength to conceive
That, with treatment, this cancer will leave
Me alone with my life
And my kids and my wife
And result in a lengthy reprieve.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Here's perplexity: gather around,
For within, Leonard Cohen is found.
He's an angst-ridden poet
(Read his works, and you'll know it)
Who's adored by the rich and renowned.

limerick_list.author: Chrain
limerick_list.text:
Our astronauts circled the earth
Ten years or so after my birth.
And then pretty soon
They walked on the moon.
Folks cheered them from Boston to Perth.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For spring-cleaning, I huffed and I puffed
Since my cellar and attic were stuffed
With foul garbage that, sadly,
Accumulates badly.
I've got to get rid of this cruft.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This is Dimetane, allergy med
That can ease your rose fever, it's said.
Brompheniramine maleate
Is likely to palliate
Those symptoms that yearly you dread.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
A miner who lived by the Tyne
Went to look for some coal in a mine,
But his naked-flamed light
Made the firedamp ignite—
Yet thank God, the canary was fine.

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
A brave and adventuresome lass
Had to brave bitter cold at Grant's Pass.
Oh, her prospects were grave
Till a Katuku Brave
Built a campfire to thaw out her ass.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
Richard Nixon kept quite a collection
Of his top secret tapes for protection.
Even after he died,
In the Archives some hide.
Please, declassify them for inspection.

limerick_list.author: KathyF
limerick_list.text:
When a bright mathematical whiz
Was expounding on data of his,
I berated him so:
"Data are! Don't you know
That it's datum that goes with an is?"

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
Akathisia results in distress
And a restless emotional mess
From the drugs that you take
For your sanity's sake —
Not unlike being sixteen, I'd guess.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The photons and gluons are kin:
All bosons have integer spin.
They think it's just great
To possess the same state,
Since no Pauli exclusion kicks in.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
Because of donations I made
(Can't remember just what it will aid),
They've acquired my name
And will soon try to shame
Me to help with another crusade.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
"That Holstein is calving!" he yelled.
Her new heifer, the mother expelled.
She didn't seem rattled,
Her nerves were not addled.
At calving, that cow had excelled.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
It is time that's controllable here;
Back or forth you can steer it! Don't sneer—
The reliable Bill,
Having admirable skill,
Tells you just when he honed it: "Next year!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Hugh likes fights; of disputes he's a fueler.
When my husband had words with our jeweler,
Hugh's suggestion was cruel:
"You two losers should duel!"
I said, "Hugh, why don't you be the dueler?"

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Alexipharmac: a poison preventive.
For a paranoid person, attentive
To poisoning plots
And connecting the dots,
There is certainly ample incentive.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
With your abstract intelligence, true,
Some may think you've a genius IQ.
But I'm not so impressed
That you conquered some test;
I've known rocks that were smarter than you.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
We've sent spacemen from each major nation
To a low-orbit satellite station,
Where robot physicians
Observe their conditions
Using bioinstrumentation.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Those coliform colonies restin'
In the folds of your colon (intestine)
Like to colonize there
'Cuz they're getting a share
Of the food that they help with digestin'.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At his birth, we rejoiced with some vino,
But now Dino, our son, has adreno-
leukodystrophy. Life
Has been hard since my wife
Learned her gene has foredoomed our bambino.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Whats an entremet? When is it seen?
It's a dinner dish, served in between
Two regular courses.
Whatever its source is,
It makes diners' palates feel clean.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Dan's a dancer but really can't bear
All the dancewear they force him to wear.
He will cuss long and hard
In a tight leotard.
In a tutu too—man, can Dan swear!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
From where has that aircraft just come?
Or where in the loaf is one crumb?
Parameters three
Give the answer, you see:
They're cylindrical coordinates, chum.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Yes, the bill of the pelican relican
Hold more than his pelican belican.
People still see how welican
But not how the helican
Stock more than a pelican delican.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
What's ahead of us, no one can state.
Our demise may come early, or late;
But each life, good or bad,
Whether happy, or sad,
Ends with death.  And that's everyone's fate.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When the Christmas tree's up, we're excited
By our visions of Santa, alighted.
In the oil patch, its role
Is to cover a hole
So that gifts don't arrive uninvited.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To construct a contingency table,
Draw columns and rows, and then label.
When done with design,
Load the data, refine:
Now mine it for stats — if you're able.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
This communion, worldwide, has its druthers
To work for the poor, amongst others;
Most especially for youth,
And to bring them God's truth.
It's the Catholic Church Christian Brothers.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
These parasites, apicomplexans,
Sicken arthropods, molluscs and Texans
By base self-insertion
In cells. Such subversion
Starts thousands of nasty infexans.

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
On my lap now my dulcimer lies;
As I play it, the audience cries.
My instrument sings
With the plucking of strings
And the sweet sounds of musical sighs.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
To attribute:  that means "to assign
A named quality" — thus to refine
Something's clear definition
And assist in cognition
Of attributes it may combine.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
I submitted a limerick here,
But parts of it didn't appear
.........................................
....................................... —
Due to data loss ........, I fear.

limerick_list.author: RGiskard
limerick_list.text:
The burglar who moves like a snail
Will surely be carted to jail.
Once there, he's distraught
O'er the big bucks he sought,
Because this time he needs them for bail.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Lasting peace takes finesse; war is cruder.
Take the plane that they call The Intruder.
The A-6 will prevail
After peace forums fail.
If your plans involve bombs, you'll include 'er.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Coefficients of accommodation
Give, for molecules, some explanation
Of the fraction that sticks
To a wall—four of six?
(The two others rebound in vibration).

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
I have finished the first fifty-four
And my stomach's so full that it's sore,
But your cakes are so good
That it's well understood:
I am eating another (one more).

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
We shared latitude, longitude too,
But our hemispheres differed, you knew.
We're antoecial, which makes
Us antoeci, lands sakes!
World of difference between me and you.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
On the old Woodrow Wilson Bridge rubble
Shipped down to Point Lookout, a bubble
Of oyster spat hulches;
This reef-to-be culch is
Recycling that's well worth the trouble.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Disimbitter yourself. Be of cheer.
Make that sarcasm just disappear.
Lose that scowl; make it snappy.
This club's for the happy;
We'll welcome no sourpuss here!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Poor Kermit was venting his spleen
That his eyesight was not very keen.
He'd explained, rather topically—
And deuteranopically:
"It's not easy," he said, "seeing green."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
It was Arnold the Fifth, Count of Loon,
Who caused Middle Age maidens to swoon.
He backed Guy of Dampierre
Against Philip the Fair,
And his passing made war opportune.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When we knights tilt for pleasure with lances,
Then my cronel enhances the chances
That you'll live to fight more:
Spread-out points spare your gore,
As they fail to impale in advances.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Want to keep those who lead us in view?
I'd say C-SPAN's the channel for you.
Hear your congressmen speak,
Give the Senate a peek,
Plus conventions and funerals, too.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm my uncle's attorney-in-fact
Since we learned that the old boy is cracked,
So I tend his affairs,
Buy him bonds, sell his shares;
In his stead I can legally act.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Your curves, my dear, always delight:
I was really turned on by the sight
Of the double convexity
Shown by the sexy T-
Shirt you were wearing last night.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
Is Hester in truth to be blamed
For her sex games which cannot be named?
Good vibes? I confess
I would rather know less.
If I blush it's because I'm ashamed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My restaurant's small, but it's hot.
It's the theater crowd's favorite spot.
Sure, it's got its detractors,
But the critics and actors
Come to gab, grab a bite and just squat.

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
Brazil named this city with folly,
And the map-makers can't be too jolly—
Have to make sure instead
It cannot be misread
And mistaken for Salvador Dalí.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
As the pilots near Panama jockey
For space in the harbor, they're cocky.
But soon they stop short
When they enter the port
Since the shore by Balboa is rocky.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Gregorian monks like to sing;
Benedictines perform early swing.
I'll record their robed choir —
Sell enough to retire.
It's the chants of a lifetime. Ka-ching!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When he found the address, he felt dire
Forebodings and flashes of ire.
By a fence he was stopped.
It was locked and was topped
With some sharp concertina barbed wire.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
On a day that was mis'rably muggy,
I heard that damn train noise: chug-chuggy.
Stopped me cart at the tracks,
Let the horses relax
As that train drove, and I drove, me buggy.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He's a wonderful, hardworking judge,
Such a drudge that we dare not begrudge
Him his fondness for sweets.
So we pump him with treats
And enjoy saying, "Here come da pudge!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"These designs have excessive adorableness.
For my quarters I favor ignorableness,
With decor that is plain.
In the main," explained Jane,
"They're just more of this artist's deplorableness."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Krazy Kaskets? "Slick" Sid is the prez.
Every customer gets a free fez.
He's made gains economically
By treating folks comically.
"Put the fun back in funeral!" he says.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Corregidor: long-ago news.
On this island brave men paid their dues.
All across the Pacific,
The fight was horrific—
World War Two was the Allies' to lose.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Chromium's a hard, brittle metal
That glistens like rain on a petal.
Bright chromium plate
On an auto looks great
And for years will remain in fine fettle.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Al's an anchorite, lives like a moose
In the woods, a religious recluse.
As a hermit, he'll spend
Days in prayer without end,
But for me, I would say, "What's the use?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Back in grade school, my teacher would say,
"There's a word that's pronounced 'dee-voh-TAY.'"
Now I'm grown and I see
I prefer "dee-voh-TEE."
(Either way is completely OK.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To prepare for our blessed event,
Over twenty-five dollars was spent
Just on baby oil. Why?
I'm a penny-wise guy.
It's just mineral oil with a scent!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
When we'd finished a meal, we were able
To leave all the grown-ups at table,
But first, we'd the task
Of remembering to ask,
"Please can I get down?" recalled Mabel.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I saw your new play Friday night,
And I viewed it with less than delight.
The plot left me wincing —
Not very convincing —
Reality begs you rewrite.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
So you're willing to suffer deprival
By leaving the spoils to your rival?
This Darwinian rule
Speaks to loser and fool:
For defeatists, there ain't no  survival.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Finding Chef Boy-Ar-Dee in a can
Prompts a joke that I wish we could ban.
There is no need to shout:
"Let him out, let him out!"
It's just pasta, and not a canned man.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I do not get involved when I see
Stupid posts from my friends on FB.
To engage them would lead
To much grief I don't need.
Not responding, I just disagree.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Of experts' opinions a shaper,
He wrote the first relevant paper;
Nusselt's great contribution:
An explicit solution
For the film condensation of vapor.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Madagascar once used to use francs
For its businesses, budgets and banks.
This French-derived cash
Du peuple malgache
Should be shortened to Fmg, thanks.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Please allow me a moment or so
To transcribe your apartment to go
In a not-too-big space,
Slipping here into place
As apt. It's quite apropos.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
When I think of the byways' delight
As compared to the freeways, on sight,
I am lured on to dare,
Off the main thoroughfare,
Any dangers they hold, day or night.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The cudgels some pirates will choose,
And will use to bruise enemy crews,
Can convince the king's guards
That defeat's in the cards—
With an offer they cannot refuse.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our team's suffered a string of defeats.
Bands of hooligans wander the streets:
Large, disorderly packs
Launching random attacks,
With response cars patrolling in fleets.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Paying cash on the barrelhead, Darryl
Bought the enterprise—lock, stock, and barrel.
Now he's barely begun
Having barrels of fun,
Selling barrels of Darryl's apparel.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
In this bell foundry, school bells were cast,
Long ago, but it foundered at last,
Its finances unsound,
And it could not rebound,
Since its church bells were simply outclassed.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
Said De Soto's comptroller, with sorrow:
"When of debits you speak, don't say 'borrow'!
For your accounting ratio
Ain't defined, Don Ignacio,
With your assets divided by Zorro."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In a buckminsterfullerene ball
You can find sixty carbons in all.
A buckyball locker
For nanotech soccer
Might strike us as shockingly small.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Creeping buttercup's 'top of its class'
For its stolons, and spreading en masse.
While I cede that plants breed,
I wish this one could read,
As my notice says Keep Off The Grass!

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
There are voices inside of my head.
"I hear voices," the Active Voice said.
Passive: "Voices are heard."
Antipassive demurred —
"Well I hear, but hear from them instead."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The sewer man dropped by today;
Trimmed some roots, bored some pipes, and said, "Hey!
At the sight of such cloggage
My mind's in agoggage:
'Bout forty-three years' worth, I'd say!"

limerick_list.author: hugh.adler
limerick_list.text:
Of all the horns sax players carry,
Only one of them's able to marry
An appearance arcane
With a sound so insane—
That's the big, bad, bold beast called the bari.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
They went up for a season or so,
But the bottom's no place to plateau.
Their promotion was earned,
But they quickly returned.
We all know relegation's a blow.

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
Use your index to point, thumb to twiddle.
Use your pinkie to pluck on a fiddle.
Use your ring one to marry
(It's named annulary).
Use discretion when using your middle.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Soccer's boring!" I often proclaim.
Lack of action is largely to blame.
One solution I've found:
Spread some land mines around.
This would drastically alter the game.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I own brothels in Rome and Berlin,
Plus I'm fresh off a lottery win.
All these limericks of mine
Sell for twelve bucks a line,
So cha-ching! How the money rolls in!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Ask a scientist chap for a candle;
What he gives you is tricky to handle:
"Let platinum freeze
At 2000 degrees...."
Sure, it glows, but the cost is a scandal!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
What a waste!  I pursued and I caught
Becky Sue, but she's not what I thought.
Barking up the wrong tree
Got her married to me —
My mistake.  A divorce is now sought.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Said a witness, "I never have seen
Such a truly distinct shade of green."
"Quite unique," I groaned, "sure —
One part absinthe liqueur,
One part spicy Malaysian cuisine."

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Whom did Milton call sweet, "fancy's child",
Warbling "native [unschooled] wood-notes wild"?
Dared he damn with faint praise
The supreme wright of plays?
Yes, that's Shakespeare he slightly reviled.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
On Anguilla I loaf in the sun;
Might snorkel or go for a run.
Or not—what's the rush?
'Sides, this beachhouse is plush
And this pineapple daiquiri? Fun!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I'm the type that resents taking rest,
Which was harmful, as I convalesced.
So they tied me down tight
When they turned off the light
At eight-thirty — "It's all for the best!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A slash is a handy device
Meaning "over" (divided by). Nice,
But is "12/10"
Perhaps asinine when
"To the left of" would seem more precise?

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Our elephant's foot in the hall,
Is a place to put sticks when folk call.
Such umbrella stands may
Seem offensive today,
And on eBay?  They don't sell at all.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Your douceur is so hard to describe.
The word's French and, like words of that tribe,
Offers meanings that smart
People choose à la carte,
Such as "gentleness"; "sweetness"; "a bribe".

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When they met, they were both quite excited;
Their bodies and souls were ignited.
Their glow was so bright
It turned day into night.
Their condition? You might say: "Delighted!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Richard Simmons was feeling possessed.
He was demonomania-stressed.
Though this evil intrusion
Was just a delusion,
He went on an exorcise quest.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Lee, I've searched, but it's hard to find much
That will rhyme with the last half of crutch.
The tch dental click, Lee,
Is best pronounced quickly;
So we simply say ch in the clutch.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Plastic shoes that have very thick soles
Are attractive and play useful roles,
But in storms, wearing Crocs,
I get wet (feet and socks),
As the raindrops splash in through the holes.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A concierge at the Hotel Pierre
Told the gardener, "I really don't care
Which staff members you screw
 Or lewd acts that you do.
 Just don't mess with my guests when you're bare."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Made in China, this gift from my spouse
Is a beautiful scarlet silk blouse.
These cord frogs? They will hold
It together, I'm told
(Though to me each looks more like a mouse).

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I canoed down the river with speed,
Far too cocky to think I would need
To wear a life vest,
But it would have been best
Since I flipped the boat over, indeed!

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Hot all over, the lover boy gave her
A louver adorned with a laver.
Ah, love! The receiver,
No fever allever,
Washed up, stayed aloof, withheld favor.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
Holy Christopher carried Our Lord
Through the river the child couldn't ford.
He calmed travelers' fears,
Only now it appears
He's mere legend and shan't be adored.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Here's a gibe (to wit, taunt) he would wield,
Causing hurt if a name was revealed:
Her resolve to avert
Being labelled a flirt
Meant she always would easily yield.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
We write limericks.  It's arduous toil —
Put ideas on the stove till they boil.
Those works that are bubbly,
Not rhythmically troubly,
Are judged as according to Doyle.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In a dream, I had found myself woken
Where Abkhaz-Adyghean was spoken.
"Southern Russia?  I fear
I do not belong here."
Then I waltzed, though my legs were both broken.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Brother Juniper gained the esteem
Of the whole human race, it would seem.
This daily strip's fun
Was unique as the one
Seen worldwide with religion its theme.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
A daiquiri sure hits the spot
After long sultry days on my yacht.
But whom am I fooling?
I don't drink them for cooling—
They just help my old lady look hot.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
Treason sticks in my craw: it is vomitable.
Their hideout is known, though.  It's bomb-it-able.
From your duty don't swerve,
Use the force they deserve.
The rebellion you'll find, sir, is domitable.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
"That's claptrap!" she yammered. "What fluff!
Are you nuts, or attempting to bluff?"
So his climbdown was swift —
He, despite feeling miffed,
Couldn't backpedal quickly enough!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The person who did this is blameless.
So, Officer, please keep him nameless.
Though I'm shot in the foot,
There's no reason to put
In your book I'm the shooter—and aimless.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Not a polyglot? Rot! Ballyhoo!
Like a native I speak parley-voo.
As I jamais was truant
In French class, I'm fluent.
See, I say "Je suis Charlie", too.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
The report sent by General Grey,
A communiqué (classified A),
Listed people, he claimed,
Who could later be blamed
For the village we bombed on that day.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Through conversancy, I am acquainted
With a woman who's far from the sainted.
I found out first-hand
That she racked up five grand
On my credit card; nearly, I fainted.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
The heist we were busily plotting.
Personnel into roles we were slotting—
This for him, that for you—
When asked what did I do,
I replied, "I'm the one who's allotting."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The cosmographer studies the whole,
Not a part of the world, with this goal:
To give lectures in schools
On the order and rules
Of the cosmos—and stay off the dole.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
'Twas a dalliance, briefly defined
As when bodies (and hearts?) are entwined
For a trivial fling.
Now he's gone, here's the thing:
I just can't get him out of my mind.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The conference wants a reaction
To her speech. I was bored to distraction,
Bored right out of my skull.
Soporifically dull,
This speaker brings on stupefaction.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
When you're chasing the dragon, it's true
You can die from the high you pursue.
Fight its fiery breath,
For the dragon is death.
Slay it first, or the dragon slays you.

limerick_list.author: willupanek
limerick_list.text:
The detection for firedamp did shine.
'Twas enough to explode the whole mine.
The surveyors, perplexed,
Said, "If afterdamp's next,
Can't see how that canary is fine."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The dijudicant (a.k.a. judge)
Said, "Your Mackinac crime's just a smudge,
So community service."
But that makes me nervous —
He says I'll assist packing fudge.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Enuresis I had in the sack
With my bladder control out of whack.
I received medication
To curb urination.
My sex life is now back on track.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I'm gonna go out on a  limb,
And wager the chances are slim
That you'll guess the flash handle
Vaux gives us for candle.
Give up?  As I thought.  (Answer: glim.)

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
It's the last word beginning with a
That my lexicon features today:
Any unleavened cake
Is an azymous bake,
And the Passover bread's made that way.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Norwegian, the tongue, is a fiction:
In Norway, the grammar and diction
Is Bokmaal for most,
But where fjords cut the coast
Nynorsk is pronounced with conviction.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"When Jesus returns," my dad snorts,
"You'll see it on TV reports.
He'll appear with Jim Swaggart
(That boaster, that braggart)
And walk water on Wide World of Sports."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A bulge on the bill of a bird.
A diviner who's good as his word.
A catch on a gun
Or a burn mark (no fun).
Dried out, or to wrap those interred.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Though you think that Miss Jones is a cutie,
As her boss, it's a clear breach of duty,
To suggest that her pay
Should be linked to, let's say,
Her agreement to show you her booty.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Yes, I'll lend you some money, my friend.
Here's the contract... This bit near the end?
The acceleration clause —
Which, if payment you pause,
Means it's all due back now.  Happy spend!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Apiphobic, I'm frightened of bees,
Yet at ease with flies, beetles, and fleas.
Association can cause
Other strange phobic flaws:
I'm afraid of n's, h's, and v's.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The baker's innumerate cousin
Was mistaken more often than wasn':
'E would sell from the shelves
Lowly batches of twelves,
VErsus thirteen (a round baker's dozen).

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
What's baleful? Well, blues can be wailful,
Then ask convicts in cells, a whole jailful;
There's the moan of a sax
And a kid getting whacks.
Seen the eyes of a beagle? They're baleful.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
So I'm inking my dabber one day,
And the litho's progressing okay,
When the artist blows in
And exclaims, with chagrin,
"Back to work—I don't pay you to play!"

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
You must see our new house; it's très chic.
The design's futuristic and sleek,
All brushed steel and bright chrome.
Yes, you'll love our new home
Here on Mars. Can you fly out next week?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Cried the doomsayer, brimming with mirth,
"Watch the Judgment of everyone's worth!
Buy your tickets real soon—
Doomsday's coming at noon!
Get good seats for the end of the Earth!"

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
The annulose structure of trees
Helps scientists date things with ease.
The rings give the gauge
To determine the age,
And plant cellulose makes it a breeze.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
Jerry opens his new "Acme" pack; a
Thought bubbles up, Tom gets a smacker.
Disappointment! Alas!
This thing only makes gas
Out of oil. Why's it called a cat cracker?!

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
All his billions, at death, total eight;
Made his money by dealing in hate.
All the stuff that he owns,
Which includes rivals' bones,
Forms his (more ways than one) gross estate.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
All those ridges and grooves—hardly slick!
Corrugated—it's not what she'd pick;
But she hasn't a clue
That her neighbour's new loo
Would have cost twice as much made of brick.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
If a volume once owned by a saint
Were damaged, might worshipers faint?
It's just short of divine.
So a cumdach (a shrine)
Will encase it. Some notions seem quaint.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In a canyon, while munching on NECCOs,
I shout, "Hey!", and I listen for echos;
And with cross-correlation
(Delayed integration)
I filter out stridulent geckos.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Flown-in veggies? I leave them alone.
Give me produce that's locally grown:
Import fruits say, "Come try me,"
But the waste says, "Don't buy me."
I think twice when the food miles are known.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
To make my small software biz grow,
I solve, to find where fluids flow,
Differential equations
On many occasions.
Expensive experiments? No!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
For the die-hard Creationist squad
