They look so innoxious. Bizarre!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"I love pottery mottled and veined,
So I'll pay any price," she explained.
"It's my agate ware, which
I'd be happy to pitch
At my spouse if he ever complained."

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
Third Witch: Are you sisters insane?
Not those newts' eyes for dinner again!
They're double the trouble,
And the cauldron won't bubble
In thunder and lightning and rain.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
To demystify, let me explain,
 So it's firmly entrenched in your brain,
That there isn't a God,
And to doubt Him's not odd,
But definitive proof that you're sane.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Distensibility,  bared with tranquility,
In his girlfriend engenders hostility:
"It is all very well
That your belly can swell,
But to like it's beyond my ability."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Their whole congregate clan having sat
For two weeks, the conclusion was that
In the future the Sprats
Would renounce eating fats.
It was not a congenial chat.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Simple alkanes and alkenes are strings
Of carbons — plain linear things.
An "-ene" is no trouble:
One bond is a double,
And alkyne a triple bond brings.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We're not sure any more this is cool.
This graffiti's the work of a fool.
We're finally effacing it,
Scrubbing, erasing it,
Restoring the walls of the school.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Since his head, hands and feet were immense,
"Acromegaloid freak!" gave offense.
So to stop feeling down,
He got work as a clown:
"Shoes that fit, crowds that roar, it's intense!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Roxanne was a fleet-hound, a bitch —
A fine greyhound, a swift hound, of which
I was often ashamed,
As Rox frequently aimed
Toward a bus-hound, for whom she'd an itch.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Bake your taters for roughly an hour
At which time they'll be ripe to devour.
To bliss, you're now headed,
So add some cheese (shredded)
Or, if weight's not an issue, cream (sour).

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
With a husband at last by her side,
She was happy as ever, and cried.
Why the wedding day tears?
She had always—for years—
Been a bridesmaid, but never the bride.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
"Though it's taken some time," Betsy frowned,
"I've the best-vetted dress to be found.
I'd consulted my mother,
Our cook (and her brother),
Sought tips from all types: asked around."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
"We are earthnuts." "Geologists?" "No."
"Eco-terrorists? Tree sitters?" "Whoa!
You are way off the track—
We're just plants! You can snack
On the underground parts that we grow."

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
Just a few meters into the race
The lead runner, with pain on his face,
Stepped away, off the course,
With a bad charley horse;
When your leg cramps, you can't keep your pace.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Code Elope! Here's a case of futility:
Bruce checked out, so we've no culpability.
He'd been acting dejectedly,
Then quite unexpectedly
The patient decamped the facility.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Americans call it aluminum,
Metal so soft that a human, um,
Molds it too thin
And the noises come in.
Will somebody please stop that bloomin' hum?

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
When his boss called him in to demote him,
Bill begged leave to demur—then he smote him!
Now of menial rank
'Neath the bowels of the bank,
He's this corporate body's wee scrotum.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
In spring, all the flower consumers
Will whisper preposterous rumors
Regarding the time
When a bud's at its prime,
And anthesis exposes its bloomers.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Like a gleaner who gathers up grain
Left by reapers, so too acts my brain,
As her diary I read.
Bit by bit, her words lead
To conclusions she needs to explain.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Baby's death was an accident, purely.
You did not lock the pool up securely.
When it's all said and done,
This is not murder one,
Though it's criminal negligence, surely.

limerick_list.author: FunkyTuba
limerick_list.text:
A database guy named McClaskey
Sent a UTF file to Pulaski.
P. replied, "It's too long.
Can you tell me what's wrong?"
M. replied, "I dunno, but I'll ASCII."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Some cosmologists seek cosmic strings—
Hypermassive, anomalous things.
Others tend to suspect
That the "gee whiz effect"
Lends the strangest ideas false wings.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
This example of bootlessness may
Clearly show it means fruitlessness: say
I attempted to squeeze
On my final line (jeez)
Floccinaucinihili—. No way!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Take the maximum width, side to side,
Of the head of a man, then divide
By its length front to back
For an index whose lack
Of sound basis we rightly deride.

limerick_list.author: buttonbright
limerick_list.text:
The nudist considers it wise
To expose what we wish he'd aguise.
But as well as our skins,
There may be certain sins
That a loose-fitting outfit belies.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What long-necked, pink bird is the pride
Of Bahamian folks nationwide?
The American flamingo,
You guess? I'd say Bingo!
Playing croquet with one? It's been tried.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
My birch tree is missing, and, dammit!
Some beaver has managed to cram it
Into Stillwater Creek.
See, he's stemming a leak
With more branches to span and enjamb it.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
See her eyebrows, that flash? That's a sign:
Recognition, and likely benign.
It's impromptu and swift—
Conversational thrift.
But don't read it as "your place or mine?"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Bite your tongue, 'cause it's not very nice
To be giving unwanted advice.
Best repress those remarks.
Don't offend; you'll cause sparks
With the end of your friendships the price.

limerick_list.author: Esther Spurrill Jones
limerick_list.text:
In the middle of winter I teeter
Unless I am glued to my heater.
Watch the mercury drop:
Rising bills never stop,
For my gas meter's such a big eater.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
His distaste for state killing just grows —
Watching writhing men die he forgoes.
He'll provide absolution
Before execution,
But never attends death throe shows.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The new bloke in the condo adjacent
Is quite cheerful and helpful—complaisant.
My moods never faze him;
I'm happy to praise him.
Could a neighborly courtship be nascent?

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Now a tale from a very-great-aunt
Who would sometimes go off on a rant:
Said, "My life went to hell
As a Dixieland belle —
I once dated Ulysses S. Grant!"

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
This all-time best-seller is liable
To portrayal by some as too pliable:
No few have attacked
The arrayal of "fact"
In the Bible as unverifiable.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
When you screwed me I did what it took —
I pulled out; I renounced, I forsook
You.  I sauntered away
And I'm happy today —
No more living the life of a shnook.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Ugh! This peace pipe is giving me grief,
For I choke on this slow burning leaf.
I inhale nonetheless,
Which I hope will impress
This American Indian chief.

limerick_list.author: yoyology
limerick_list.text:
In Obeah (Caribbean lore)
It's the  duppy all people abhor.
Evil spirits like that
Make you hot-foot it, stat,
To a shaman who'll tell you the score!

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
The welder was such a great cynic,
His mask wasn't adiactinic.
He scoffed at the bright
Ultraviolet light—
Now he's sightless, contrite, at the clinic.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
"I'm under the weather," said Heather.
Her sickness soon spread; so together,
We both had the flu.
Though achooing, we knew
We'd get through it, two birds of a feather.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A physician required definition
For the medical term deglutition.
She discovered the following—
Its meaning is "swallowing"—
In Dorland's (the latest edition).

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
I despair, and my hope is now dim.
What a boss! I work daily for him.
I am under his thumb,
I feel gloomy and glum,
And my workday is gruesome and grim.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Charmeress: temptress; girl charmer,
Like one wooed by a knight in his armor,
Or by guys at the dance
Who are seeking romance,
Or by sweet Billy Bob—he's a farmer.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's colonized much of the land,
And continues to spread, to expand.
No control's guaranteed;
Still, we fight the damned weed.
Stupid kudzu is way out of hand.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Paul poops parties; his temperament's poor:
Starts to gripe when he steps through the door,
With his carps and complaints
Unrepressed by restraints—
He's the pleasure-polluter du jour.

limerick_list.author: John Wellington Wells
limerick_list.text:
An analogue's like what you've got.
It's a similar thing, but it's not
Quite exactly the same,
Like a spark and a flame,
Or the boat in your tub and my yacht.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A cardsharp makes money from poker,
While he smiles and beguiles like a joker;
And he's not above cheating
To assure that he's beating
A path, with your cash, to his broker.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
To maintain an old car was a snap;
You could reach all the plugs, set the gap.
And to thwart a car theft?
Why, the rotor you'd heft,
From beneath the distributor cap.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
An old dotard, age ninety or more,
Made a pass at a middle-aged whore.
She said, "Never, you cad!
You're as old as my dad!"
He said, "That's what Viagra is for!"

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
I firmly believed every word
Of the story whose truth you averred,
Since this verb means "declare"
(Or to "solemnly swear")
That you'd told me what really occurred.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
No sylph, Mae was busty and beamy.
She spoke in tones sultry and steamy:
"In your pocket, ol' son,
Are y' hidin' a gun?
Or are y' jes happy t' see me?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Elo's a dog that is new
Being bred to be friendly to you—
Not for looks (though they're cute).
Every breeder's pursuit
Is the best family pet, tried and true.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Can you pronounce Cannes? I can: KAN.
Also KAHN, per my Great-uncle Dan.
What a hunk of a man —
Tall, strong, handsome and tan,
From the Sunbathing Cannes-tests he ran.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
They gathered, a working men's band:
"Solidarity, bruvvers! — we stand
Here shoulder to shoulder.
Before we're much older
Clenched fists they will all understand!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Cardioaccelerators speed up the rate
Of your heart." "Like a great-looking date?"
"No, not kisses and hugs—
Pharmaceutical drugs.
Bradycardia's what they abate."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, unhand me!" exclaimed a poor sap.
"You've confused me with some other chap.
So stop giving me grief.
I'm no butt blanket thief.
I'm not guilty; this here's a bum rap."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
I finished my last shopping chore with
A sigh; I returned from the store with
A bolt.  Now my stock
Is secured by a lock
And a pin that I fasten the door with.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Ahimelech said to Saul, "Lord,
It is true I took David aboard.
But Doeg's just fretting—
He calls it abetting—
I gave Dave Goliath's old sword."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In a large tub of water, Bob found
Twenty apples all bobbing around.
This was new to him, sadly.
He played the game badly.
On his very first turn, Bobby drowned.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
To be or not be? — There's the question.
You'll get by; it's all at your discretion.
A first-year pass/fail class,
Bring one essay (alas!),
And attend what you can of the session.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
It's a problem for people like me:
The "as soon as" in ASAP.
With my feet in the way,
I can't even sashay —
I'd be slow at a snail jamboree.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
First she cries then she laughs then she cries,
On and on. This should be no surprise:
Dacrygelosis will mean
To Yvonne, who's a teen,
That she's not a big hit with the guys.

limerick_list.author: Nan
limerick_list.text:
In my brain was a lim'rick aborning.
It arrived just like that with no warning.
Wrote it down in a trice,
Sent it off quick and nice —
The OEDILF on this day it's adorning.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An adhocracy governs this city.
The results, I attest, are not pretty.
Our standing will worsen
Until there's one person
In charge—not this "rule by committee."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Now just how might a person express
Unconditional coldness?  I guess
One could say, "I don't care
Not a hair!" or declare
That one could (or one couldn't) care less.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A baby bump's something we see
On a blossoming mother-to-be.
Her abdominal swelling,
Now showing, is telling
Us all: "That's how two becomes three."

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Did I mention the pension convention?
There was tension and then some contention.
Fierce debate about perks
(Who, what, why, how it works)
Caused dissention, then meeting suspension.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The Development Fund for Iraq
Was established once Bush's attack
Had succeeded; yes, now
He could solemnly vow
That his plan was to give something back.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
I dream of the havoc I'll wreak
In the pale shafts of moonlight, so weak.
Slanted rays form in bars,
And the smouldering stars
Glower down at me: "Whisper — don't shriek."

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
